sentence: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Mehmet Oz, warding off criticism from a key rival in Pennsylvania’s heated Republican primary race for U.S. Senate, said Wednesday that he will renounce his dual citizenship in Turkey if he is elected, as the expensive campaign took on a harder and more personal edge.
author: Marc Levy
title: Oz vows to renounce Turkish citizenship if elected senator

sentence: Apparently he's planning on carrying his Turkish dual citizenship into the Senate, even if it means that he won't have a Senator's security clearance: Republican U.S. Senate candidate Mehmet Oz said today that he would forego certain security clearances that are provided to all U.S.

sentence: Pennsylvania Republican Senate candidate and TV personality Dr. Mehmet Oz told reporters Tuesday that if elected in November, he would be willing to give up certain security clearances in order to keep his U.S.-Turkish dual citizenship.

title: Dr. Mehmet Oz suggests he would give up Senate security clearances to keep Turkish dual citizenship

sentence: Pennsylvania Senate candidate Mehmet Oz said Wednesday he will renounce his Turkish citizenship if elected to the U.S. Senate, reversing an earlier claim that he would maintain dual citizenship even if it meant forgoing classified briefings.
